meaning_en: easy to reach or use; affordable/available

example: The syllabus lists weekly readings and assignments.

meaning_en: able to continue without harming the environment
example: We promote sustainable transportation options.

example: The city set targets to reduce carbon emissions.

meaning_en: the protection of natural resources

example: We chose the platform for its reliability.

meaning_en: to find and fix the cause of a problem
example: Follow these steps to troubleshoot your connection.
examples: Follow these steps to troubleshoot your connection.

meaning_en: a period when a service is unavailable
example: The outage lasted for nearly two hours.
examples: The outage lasted for nearly two hours.

meaning_en: a person who offers services willingly

examples: He decided to volunteer at the local shelter.
Volunteers help to volunteer work in the area.

meaning_en: area where people live near each other
example: It's a quiet neighbourhood with tree-lined streets.
examples: It's a quiet neighbourhood with tree-lined streets.

meaning_en: a local law or regulation
example: A new ordinance restricts overnight parking.

meaning_en: the extent to which something is reasonably priced
example: Housing affordability remains a key concern.

meaning_en: the percentage charged for borrowing money

meaning_en: not paid or done by the expected time
example: Your invoice is overdue by ten days.

meaning_en: to make a process more efficient
examples: We plan to streamline operations to reduce delays.
The new tool helps streamline the onboarding workflow.

meaning_en: possible and practical to achieve
examples: Is a two-week turnaround feasible?

meaning_en: to travel regularly between home and work
examples: My daily commute takes about forty minutes by train.
A long commute can affect productivity and well-being.

meaning_en: positive reputation and customer trust
examples: They offered a partial refund as a gesture of goodwill.
Transparent communication helps build goodwill.

meaning_en: the act of following rules or standards
examples: Clinics must ensure regulatory compliance.
We audit processes to improve compliance with safety standards.

meaning_en: the act of assigning someone to a level or role
examples: New students must take a placement test.
The college offers job placement support after graduation.

meaning_en: to make less severe or harmful
examples: Trees can help mitigate urban heat.
Policies were introduced to mitigate environmental impact.

meaning_en: duplication of critical components for reliability
examples: The platform includes redundancy to prevent outages.
Built-in redundancy improves overall reliability.

meaning_en: an event held to collect money for a cause
examples: The community will host a fundraiser for the shelter.
Local businesses donated prizes for the fundraiser.

meaning_en: legal responsibility; also debts owed
examples: The company accepted legal liability for the damages.
Short-term liabilities increased this quarter.

meaning_en: the act of making information known
examples: Landlords must provide full disclosure of known issues.
Mandatory disclosure protects tenants' rights.

meaning_en: official recognition that standards are met
examples: The program is seeking international accreditation.
Schools must maintain accreditation to issue diplomas.

meaning_en: a person who rents a home or unit
examples: Prospective tenants must provide references.
Know your tenant rights before signing any document.
example: Prospective tenants must provide references.

meaning_en: money paid in advance as security
examples: The landlord requires a one-month security deposit.
The deposit is refundable if there is no damage.
example: The landlord requires a one-month security deposit.

meaning_en: work done to keep property in good condition
examples: Submit a maintenance request through the portal.
Routine maintenance extends the building's lifespan.
example: Submit a maintenance request through the portal.

meaning_en: a loan to buy property
examples: Our mortgage payment is due on the first of each month.
They secured mortgage approval after improving their credit.
example: Our mortgage payment is due on the first of each month.

meaning_en: the legal removal of a tenant from a property
examples: The landlord issued an eviction notice after months of nonpayment.
Legal aid can help tenants who face eviction.
example: The landlord issued an eviction notice after months of nonpayment.

meaning_en: basic services such as water, electricity, or gas
examples: Rent includes utilities for water and heat.
Please set up utilities before moving in.
example: Rent includes utilities for water and heat.

meaning_en: to rent your place to someone else for a time
examples: You need written permission to sublet the apartment.
We plan to sublet the room for the summer.
example: You need written permission to sublet the apartment.

meaning_en: rules that control how land can be used
examples: The project needs a zoning permit before construction.
This area is zoned for residential use only.
example: The project needs a zoning permit before construction.

meaning_en: the process of welcoming and training new staff
examples: Our onboarding process includes a mentor for each new hire.
The onboarding plan reduces early turnover.
example: Our onboarding process includes a mentor for each new hire.

meaning_en: the ability to keep employees long-term
examples: Flexible schedules improved our retention rate.
We launched a retention strategy focused on growth.
example: Flexible schedules improved our retention rate.

meaning_en: a standard to compare performance against
examples: We used the industry benchmark to evaluate our results.
Teams benchmark performance quarterly.
example: We used the industry benchmark to evaluate our results.

meaning_en: to set aside resources for a purpose
examples: We need to allocate more time for testing.
The board voted to allocate budget to training.
example: We need to allocate more time for testing.

meaning_en: tasks that have piled up and remain to be done
examples: We scheduled a sprint to clear the backlog.
Backlog grooming keeps priorities up to date.
example: We scheduled a sprint to clear the backlog.

meaning_en: a person or group affected by a decision
examples: We gathered stakeholder feedback before launching.
Key stakeholders will attend the review meeting.
example: We gathered stakeholder feedback before launching.

meaning_en: the total pay and benefits for work
examples: We offer a competitive remuneration package.
Total remuneration includes bonuses and benefits.
example: We offer a competitive remuneration package.

meaning_en: time worked beyond normal hours
examples: Employees must get approval before working overtime.
Paid overtime is calculated at a higher rate.
example: Employees must get approval before working overtime.

meaning_en: a trial period before a job becomes permanent
examples: New hires have a three-month probation period.
Performance is reviewed while you're on probation.
example: New hires have a three-month probation period.

meaning_en: a specific result or item to be delivered
examples: All project deliverables are listed in the contract.
Please submit the deliverables by Friday.
example: All project deliverables are listed in the contract.

meaning_en: the price paid for a trip on public transport
examples: Bus fares will increase next month.
Students get a reduced fare with valid ID.
example: Bus fares will increase next month.

meaning_en: a place where you switch lines or routes
examples: The new interchange reduces transfer times.
This station is the main interchange for three lines.
example: The new interchange reduces transfer times.

meaning_en: arranging shared rides through an app
examples: Ride-sharing options are cheaper during off-peak hours.
The ride-sharing app added airport pickups.
example: Ride-sharing options are cheaper during off-peak hours.

meaning_en: relating to people walking
examples: Use the pedestrian crossing at the lights.
The city improved pedestrian safety downtown.
example: Use the pedestrian crossing at the lights.

meaning_en: a lane reserved for cyclists
examples: A new protected bike lane runs along the avenue.
The painted bike lane will be upgraded next year.
example: A new protected bike lane runs along the avenue.

meaning_en: to share a car ride with others
examples: We carpool to work to save on fuel.
The carpool lane requires at least two passengers.
example: We carpool to work to save on fuel.

meaning_en: a temporary block of a traffic lane
examples: Expect delays due to an overnight lane closure.
A lane closure is in effect near the bridge.
example: Expect delays due to an overnight lane closure.

meaning_en: a schedule of departure and arrival times
examples: The new timetable adds more weekend trains.
Please check the timetable before you travel.
example: The new timetable adds more weekend trains.

meaning_en: the time taken to complete a request
examples: We aim for a 24-hour turnaround time on claims.
Automation reduced the turnaround time significantly.
example: We aim for a 24-hour turnaround time on claims.

meaning_en: an action taken after an initial contact
examples: I'll send a follow-up email with the details.
Let's schedule a follow-up next week.
example: I'll send a follow-up email with the details.

meaning_en: the act of solving an issue
examples: Our goal is first-contact resolution.
We track resolution time for each ticket.
example: Our goal is first-contact resolution.

meaning_en: a record of a customer's request for help
examples: Please include the ticket number in your reply.
All new issues enter the ticket queue.
example: Please include the ticket number in your reply.

meaning_en: a promise to repair or replace a product
examples: This device is still under warranty.
Submit a warranty claim with your receipt.
example: This device is still under warranty.

meaning_en: a system that rewards repeat customers
examples: Members earn points through the loyalty program.
You can redeem points for travel vouchers.
example: Members earn points through the loyalty program.

meaning_en: a questionnaire about service quality
examples: We send a satisfaction survey after each repair.
Survey results guide training priorities.
example: We send a satisfaction survey after each repair.

meaning_en: a contract that defines service targets
examples: We must meet the SLA for response and resolution.
An SLA breach triggers a penalty.
example: We must meet the SLA for response and resolution.

meaning_en: a test used to find a condition early
examples: The clinic offers free health screening on Fridays.
Screening programs can detect issues early.
example: The clinic offers free health screening on Fridays.

meaning_en: unintended effects of a medicine or treatment
examples: You may experience mild side effects like fatigue.
Report any side effects to your provider.
example: You may experience mild side effects like fatigue.

meaning_en: a doctor's order for medicine
examples: You can fill the prescription at any pharmacy.
Some prescription medications are not covered.
example: You can fill the prescription at any pharmacy.

meaning_en: the amount and frequency of medicine
examples: Do not change the dosage without medical advice.
The doctor will adjust the dosage after the test.
example: Do not change the dosage without medical advice.

meaning_en: a meeting with a professional for advice
examples: Book a consultation to discuss treatment options.
The clinic offers a free consultation for new patients.
example: Book a consultation to discuss treatment options.

meaning_en: a list of people waiting for a service
examples: You're on the waitlist and will be contacted soon.
The new clinic aims to reduce the waitlist.
example: You're on the waitlist and will be contacted soon.

meaning_en: the services paid for by insurance
examples: Check your insurance coverage before the procedure.
Some therapies have limited coverage.
example: Check your insurance coverage before the procedure.

meaning_en: signs or feelings that show illness
examples: Report any new symptoms to your doctor.
Common symptoms include fever and a persistent cough.
example: Report any new symptoms to your doctor.
